story.iWant: to configure Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui with the project's color palette
story.soThat: we can build consistent UI components efficiently
story.tasks: - [x] **Task: Install and Configure shadcn/ui (AC: 2, 3, 4)** - [x] Run `npx shadcn-ui@latest init` to initialize the library. - [x] Update `tailwind.config.ts` and `globals.css` to match the color palette and typography specified in the UX Design Specification. - [x] Add the `Button` component using `npx shadcn-ui@latest add button`. - [x] **Test Subtask:** Create a simple test page or component to render the `Button` and verify its styling against the design spec. - [x] **Task: Set Global Font (AC: 5)** - [x] Update `app/layout.tsx` or `globals.css` to ensure the `Inter` font is applied as the default font for the application. - [x] **Test Subtask:** Inspect the rendered text in a browser's developer tools to confirm the `Inter` font is being used.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** The project is initialized 2. **When** I install `shadcn/ui` and configure `tailwind.config.ts` 3. **Then** The color palette from UX Spec (Primary: #4299E1, Secondary: #48BB78, Destructive: #E53E3E, Background: #1A202C) is available as utility classes (e.g., `bg-primary`, `text-destructive`) 4. **And** I can import and use a basic `Button` component from `@/components/ui/button` 5. **And** The global font is set to `Inter`

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Chosen Design System: shadcn/ui. Rationale: Given the existing strong visual direction from the mockups and the project's use of Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui is an ideal choice.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Color Palette: Primary Accent (Blue): #4299E1, Secondary Accent (Green): #48BB78, Tertiary Accent (Yellow/Orange): #ECC94B, Destructive/Warning (Red): #E53E3E, Background: #1A202C. Typography: Font Family: Inter.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Styling: Tailwind CSS | v4.x | All UI Epics | Rapid UI development, consistent with `shadcn/ui` component library. Component Library: shadcn/ui | Latest | All UI Epics | Provides accessible, customizable foundation components (Buttons, Dialogs) that integrate perfectly with Tailwind.

story-context.constraints: - Use `shadcn/ui` for the component library. - Use `Tailwind CSS` for styling. - The color palette defined in the UX Design Specification must be used. - The default font for the application must be `Inter`.

tests.ideas: - Create a test page that renders the `Button` component with different variants to visually verify the styles. - Write a unit test that asserts that the `Button` component renders without crashing.
